Detailed Description

Component of a Gaussian Mixture Model.

double  sigmaxy,

Initialize with known values. 

00021                                          {
00022         mux = cx;
00023         muy = cy;
00024         sxx = varx;
00025         syy = vary;
00026         sxy = sigmaxy;
00027         wt = inwt;
00028         det = Math.abs(sxx * syy - sxy * sxy);
00029         denom = 2 * Math.PI * Math.sqrt(det);
00030     }

edu.ou.asgbook.gmm.GaussianComponent.GaussianComponent ( Pixel[]  pixels,
double[]  wts 
)

Finds best fit (the M-step in E-M). 

00078                                                            {
00079         int n_pts = pixels.length;
00080         if (wts.length != pixels.length){
00081             throw new IllegalArgumentException("Array lengths have to match");
00082         }
00083         // compute pi_k (wt)
00084         wt = 0;
00085         for (int i = 0; i < n_pts; ++i) {
00086             wt += wts[i];
00087         }
00088         wt /= n_pts;
00089 
00090         // mean
00091         Expectation wm_x = new Expectation(), wm_y = new Expectation();
00092         for (int i = 0; i < n_pts; ++i) {
00093             wm_x.update(pixels[i].getX(), wts[i]);
00094             wm_y.update(pixels[i].getY(), wts[i]);
00095         }
00096         mux = wm_x.result();
00097         muy = wm_y.result();
00098 
00099         // covariance matrix
00100         Expectation wv_x = new Expectation();
00101         Expectation wv_y = new Expectation();
00102         Expectation cv_xy = new Expectation();
00103         for (int i = 0; i < n_pts; ++i) {
00104             double dx = pixels[i].getX() - mux;
00105             double dy = pixels[i].getY() - muy;
00106             wv_x.update(dx * dx, wts[i]);
00107             wv_y.update(dy * dy, wts[i]);
00108             cv_xy.update(dx * dy, wts[i]);
00109         }
00110         sxx = wv_x.result();
00111         syy = wv_y.result();
00112         sxy = cv_xy.result();
00113 
00114         final double EPSILON = 0.01; // at-least 1/10 pixel of variance ...
00115         if (sxx < EPSILON || syy < EPSILON) {
00116             det = denom = 0;
00117             return;
00118         }
00119 
00120         // normalizing constant
00121         det = (sxx * syy - sxy * sxy);
00122         denom = 2 * Math.PI * Math.sqrt(Math.abs(det)); // always positive
00123 
00124     }

double edu.ou.asgbook.gmm.GaussianComponent.computeProbabilityDensityAt ( double  x,
double  y 
)

Value of Normal function at x,y given these parameters.

You typically want to weight this contribution by getWeight() This goes into the E-step in E-M. 

00135                                                                   {
00136         if (denom < 0.00001) {
00137             return 0;
00138         } // singular
00139         double dx = x - mux;
00140         double dy = y - muy;
00141         double term = -(syy * dx * dx - 2 * sxy * dx * dy + sxx * dy * dy);
00142         double num = Math.exp(term / (2 * det));
00143         double result = num / denom;
00144         if (result > 1) {
00145             // usually because of numerical instability
00146             return 0;
00147         }
00148         return result;
00149 
00150     }
